tender.translation[0].definitions[0].def: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
tender.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
tender.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a part of your body that is tender is painful if someone touches it
tender.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: My arm is still tender where I bruised it.
tender.translation[0].definitions[2].def: gentle and careful in a way that shows love
tender.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Her voice was tender and soft.
tender.translation[0].definitions[3].def: easily damaged – used especially about plants or flowers
tender.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: tender plants that were killed by the harsh winter
tender.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to formally offer or show something to someone
tender.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: As company secretary, you must tender the proposal.
Minton tendered her resignation on Friday.
The seller has the right to keep the goods until payment is tendered to him.
tender.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price
tender.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: We are unable to tender competitively for the contract.
tender.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services
tender.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Our bid was the lowest tender.
The contract for building the houses will be put out to tender.
tender.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a small boat that takes people or supplies between the shore and a larger boat
tender.translation[2].definitions[2].def: part of a steam train used for carrying coal and water for the train
tender.translation[3].definitions[0].def: an offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price, usually as part of a competition between several companies for the same work
tender.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Their bid was £150,000 more than the lowest tender.
Councillors agreed that the contract to build the homes should be put out to (=offered for) tender.
tender.translation[3].definitions[1].def: an offer to buy shares, which will be sold to the investor who offers the highest amount
tender.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: Some tender offers stipulate a minimum price for offers.
tender.translation[3].definitions[2].def: an offer of the exact amount of money in CASH (=coins and notes) needed to pay for something
tender.translation[4].definitions[0].def: to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services at a particular price
tender.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: The company said it is unable to tender competitively for contracts unless it has the flexibility of Sunday working.
tender.translation[4].definitions[1].def: to make a formal offer to buy or sell shares at a particular price
tender.translation[4].definitions[1].exa: Stockholders must tender for their shares by a specified expiration date.
The company has agreed to tender for two million of the shares at $4 a share.
tender.translation[4].definitions[2].def: to offer or show something to someone
tender.translation[4].definitions[2].exa: She will tender a proposal at the meeting.
The company vice-president had tendered his resignation (=officially said he wanted to leave his job).
